instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4926: What is 820-4926? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_S0_PGOOD: What is PM_S0_PGOOD?  PM_S0_PGOOD is created when CPUVR_PGOOD and ALL_SYS_PWRGD are present and branches off to become PM_PCH_PWROK. PM_S0_PGOOD and SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD are necessary to create SYS_PWROK_R and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4926</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 460ma no video no chime
threads.message:
Hi is there a quick way to tell if the cpu is dead on this model?. Im getting 460ma. I have tried a new clean bios from this forum but still the same. No evidence of spillage on the board. Checked termination spi resistors also.

L7310/L7320 have 1.8v
L7630 has 1.05v
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PM_S0_PGOOD</SIGNAL>  3.4v
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4926</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 460ma no video no chime
threads.message:
Did you check for USB activity?
No RAM beep error?
Check for damage near the CPU screw holes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4926</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 460ma no video no chime
threads.message: No usb activity. No ram beep initially but now getting 3 beeps. And no screw damage near cpu.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4926</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 460ma no video no chime
threads.message:
RAM, or CPU problem.
Try to reflow the RAM chips first.
Better to reball, as not to many chips in this case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4926</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a 460ma no video no chime
threads.message: Just waiting on decent stencil to arrive. Thanks for sticking in there. Your help is much appreciated.
